meanings.definition: A device that can both transmit and receive signals.
meanings.sent1: The transceiver on the spaceship allowed the astronauts to communicate with Earth.
meanings.sent2: I bought a new transceiver for my computer to improve the Wi-Fi connection.
meanings.sent3: The alien's transceiver was so advanced, it could even pick up signals from other galaxies.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a transceiver, constantly sending and receiving thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The transceiver blinked with each incoming message, like a friendly robot.

meanings.definition: To transmit and receive signals using a transceiver.
meanings.sent1: We will transceiver the data to the main server for analysis.
meanings.sent2: He transceivers messages through his walkie-talkie during the camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The spy transceivered secret codes to his partner across the crowded room.
meanings.sent4: The radio tower transceivered signals to ships out at sea, guiding them safely.
meanings.sent5: The satellite transceivered information back to Earth, completing its mission successfully.
